verses.text_plain: Then there was a famine in the days of David three years, year after year; and David enquired of the Lord. And the Lord answered, It is for Saul, and for his bloody house, because he slew the Gibeonites.
verses.verse_html:
1Then there was a famine in the days of David three years, year after year; and David enquired of the Lord. And the Lord answered, It is for Saul, and for his bloody house, because he slew the Gibeonites. ▼
▼ enquired…: Heb. sought the face, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ enquired…: Heb. sought the face, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ enquired…: Heb. sought the face, etc

verses.text_plain: And the king called the Gibeonites, and said unto them; (now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but of the remnant of the Amorites; and the children of Israel had sworn unto them: and Saul sought to slay them in his zeal to the children of Israel and Judah.)
verses.verse_html: 2And the king called the Gibeonites, and said unto them; (now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but of the remnant of the Amorites; and the children of Israel had sworn unto them: and Saul sought to slay them in his zeal to the children of Israel and Judah.)

verses.text_plain: Wherefore David said unto the Gibeonites, What shall I do for you? and wherewith shall I make the atonement, that ye may bless the inheritance of the Lord?
verses.verse_html: 3Wherefore David said unto the Gibeonites, What shall I do for you? and wherewith shall I make the atonement, that ye may bless the inheritance of the Lord?

tokens.text: for you? and wherewith shall I make the atonement

verses.text_plain: And the Gibeonites said unto him, We will have no silver nor gold of Saul, nor of his house; neither for us shalt thou kill any man in Israel. And he said, What ye shall say, that will I do for you.
verses.verse_html:
4And the Gibeonites said unto him, We will have no silver nor gold of Saul, nor of his house; neither for us shalt thou kill any man in Israel. And he said, What ye shall say, that will I do for you. ▼
▼ We will…: or, It is not silver nor gold that we have to do with Saul or his house, neither pertains it to us to kill, etc

tokens.text: unto him, We will have no silver
neither for us shalt thou kill

footnotes.body_text: ▼ We will…: or, It is not silver nor gold that we have to do with Saul or his house, neither pertains it to us to kill, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ We will…: or, It is not silver nor gold that we have to do with Saul or his house, neither pertains it to us to kill, etc

verses.text_plain: And they answered the king, The man that consumed us, and that devised against us that we should be destroyed from remaining in any of the coasts of Israel,
verses.verse_html:
5And they answered the king, The man that consumed us, and that devised against us that we should be destroyed from remaining in any of the coasts of Israel, ▼
▼ devised…: or, cut us off

footnotes.body_html: ▼ devised…: or, cut us off

verses.text_plain: Let seven men of his sons be delivered unto us, and we will hang them up unto the Lord in Gibeah of Saul, whom the Lord did choose. And the king said, I will give them.
verses.verse_html:
6Let seven men of his sons be delivered unto us, and we will hang them up unto the Lord in Gibeah of Saul, whom the Lord did choose. And the king said, I will give them. ▼
▼ whom…: or, chosen of the Lord

tokens.text: unto us, and we will hang them up

footnotes.body_text: ▼ whom…: or, chosen of the Lord
footnotes.body_html: ▼ whom…: or, chosen of the Lord

verses.text_plain: But the king spared Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan the son of Saul, because of the Lord’s oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.
verses.verse_html: 7But the king spared Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan the son of Saul, because of the Lord’s oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.

verses.text_plain: But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bare unto Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth; and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she brought up for Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite:
verses.verse_html:
8But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bare unto Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth; and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she brought up for Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite: ▼
▼ Michal: or, Michal’s sister
 , ▼
▼ brought…: Heb. bear to Adriel

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Michal: or, Michal’s sister
▼ brought…: Heb. bear to Adriel

verses.text_plain: And he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them in the hill before the Lord: and they fell all seven together, and were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, in the beginning of barley harvest.
verses.verse_html: 9And he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them in the hill before the Lord: and they fell all seven together, and were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, in the beginning of barley harvest.

verses.text_plain: And Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth, and spread it for her upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water dropped upon them out of heaven, and suffered neither the birds of the air to rest on them by day, nor the beasts of the field by night.
verses.verse_html: 10And Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth, and spread it for her upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water dropped upon them out of heaven, and suffered neither the birds of the air to rest on them by day, nor the beasts of the field by night.

tokens.text: it for her upon the rock

verses.text_plain: And it was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.
verses.verse_html: 11And it was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.

verses.text_plain: And David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from the men of Jabesh–gilead, which had stolen them from the street of Beth–shan, where the Philistines had hanged them, when the Philistines had slain Saul in Gilboa:
verses.verse_html: 12And David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from the men of Jabesh–gilead, which had stolen them from the street of Beth–shan, where the Philistines had hanged them, when the Philistines had slain Saul in Gilboa:

verses.text_plain: And he brought up from thence the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son; and they gathered the bones of them that were hanged.
verses.verse_html: 13And he brought up from thence the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son; and they gathered the bones of them that were hanged.

verses.text_plain: And the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son buried they in the country of Benjamin in Zelah, in the sepulchre of Kish his father: and they performed all that the king commanded. And after that God was intreated for the land.
verses.verse_html: 14And the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son buried they in the country of Benjamin in Zelah, in the sepulchre of Kish his father: and they performed all that the king commanded. And after that God was intreated for the land.

verses.text_plain: Moreover the Philistines had yet war again with Israel; and David went down, and his servants with him, and fought against the Philistines: and David waxed faint.
verses.verse_html: 15Moreover the Philistines had yet war again with Israel; and David went down, and his servants with him, and fought against the Philistines: and David waxed faint.

verses.text_plain: And Ishbi–benob, which was of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose spear weighed three hundred shekels of brass in weight, he being girded with a new sword, thought to have slain David.
verses.verse_html:
16And Ishbi–benob, which was of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose spear weighed three hundred shekels of brass in weight, he being girded with a new sword, thought to have slain David. ▼
▼ the giant: or, Rapha
 , ▼
▼ spear: Heb. the staff, or, the head

footnotes.body_html: ▼ the giant: or, Rapha

footnotes.body_text: ▼ spear: Heb. the staff, or, the head
footnotes.body_html: ▼ spear: Heb. the staff, or, the head

verses.text_plain: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah succoured him, and smote the Philistine, and killed him. Then the men of David sware unto him, saying, Thou shalt go no more out with us to battle, that thou quench not the light of Israel.
verses.verse_html:
17But Abishai the son of Zeruiah succoured him, and smote the Philistine, and killed him. Then the men of David sware unto him, saying, Thou shalt go no more out with us to battle, that thou quench not the light of Israel. ▼
▼ light: Heb. candle, or, lamp

tokens.text: no more out with us to battle

footnotes.body_html: ▼ light: Heb. candle, or, lamp

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass after this, that there was again a battle with the Philistines at Gob: then Sibbechai the Hushathite slew Saph, which was of the sons of the giant.
verses.verse_html:
18And it came to pass after this, that there was again a battle with the Philistines at Gob: then Sibbechai the Hushathite slew Saph, which was of the sons of the giant. ▼
▼ the giant: or, Rapha
 , ▼
▼ Saph: or, Sippai

tokens.text: And it came to pass after this
that there was again a battle

footnotes.body_html: ▼ the giant: or, Rapha

verses.text_plain: And there was again a battle in Gob with the Philistines, where Elhanan the son of Jaare–oregim, a Beth–lehemite, slew the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
verses.verse_html:
19And there was again a battle in Gob with the Philistines, where Elhanan the son of Jaare–oregim, a Beth–lehemite, slew the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam. ▼
▼ Jaare–oregim: or, Jair

tokens.text: And there was again a battle

verses.text_plain: And there was yet a battle in Gath, where was a man of great stature, that had on every hand six fingers, and on every foot six toes, four and twenty in number; and he also was born to the giant.
verses.verse_html:
20And there was yet a battle in Gath, where was a man of great stature, that had on every hand six fingers, and on every foot six toes, four and twenty in number; and he also was born to the giant. ▼
▼ the giant: or, Rapha

tokens.text: And there was yet a battle

footnotes.body_html: ▼ the giant: or, Rapha

verses.text_plain: And when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea the brother of David slew him.
verses.verse_html:
21And when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea the brother of David slew him. ▼
▼ defied: or, reproached
 , ▼
▼ Shimea: also called, Shammah

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Shimea: also called, Shammah

verses.text_plain: These four were born to the giant in Gath, and fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.
verses.verse_html: 22These four were born to the giant in Gath, and fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.
